title: Who left Strictly Come Dancing last night in the second elimination?
text:
The judges gave out plenty of high scores on Strictly this week – but who wasn’t so lucky? (Picture: BBC)

Strictly Come Dancing just bid farewell to its second celebrity of 2019 following Saturday night’s annual movie week.

The show saw 14 couples take to the floor, delivering everything from Charlestons to cha chas – and the first couple’s choice routine of the series – as they made their bid to stay in the competition.

But at the end of it all another couple was shown the ballroom door – so whose dancing days are over?

Here’s who was eliminated on Sunday night’s show…

Who left Strictly Come Dancing last night?

Sunday night’s elimination show saw Anneka Rice and Kevin Clifton become the second couple to exit the 2019 series.

The Strictly Come Dancing challenge is over for Anneka (Picture: BBC)

The pair lost out after finding themselves in the dance-off with David James and Nadiya Bychkova – who were in the bottom two for the second week in a row.

Advertisement

Advertisement

And once again the judges chose to save David and Nadiya, with all four opting to keep them in the competition after they had reprised their Batman-themed American Smooth and Anneka and Kevin had once again performed their Kill Bill-inspired Charleston.

‘To be honest, I’d have saved David and Nadiya,’ the TV veteran said afterwards.

‘I’ve just loved this whole thing; I’ve not one negative about the whole experience. We’ve worked really hard, I’m covered in bruises. I love this man; it’s been a joy to have that honour, that privilege of learning to dance.

It’s a whole new world to me Tess. I love all that gang up there! Now I’ve got 11 and a half (dance) moves! My son is getting married next year, I’m determined to be able to shuffle onto the dance floor and not do my usual thing of handing out the canapes.’

Anneka and Kevin scored just 11 points for their routine on Saturday night, leaving them bottom of the leaderboard in a night which also saw actor Kelvin Fletcher win the first perfect 10s of the series.

Anneka and Kevin scored just 11 points for their Kill Bill routine (Picture: BBC)

It’s the earliest departure from the series ever for Kevin Clifton, who since joining the show in 2013 has only missed out on the final once, when he partnered Susan Calman in 2017.

The Grimsby-born dancer has previously danced all the way to the end with the likes of Frankie Bridge and Louise Redknapp – but finally got his hands on the Glitterball last year when he partnered series champion Stacey Dooley.

Advertisement

Advertisement

Who else has left Strictly Come Dancing 2019 so far?

Anneka’s departure follows that of James Cracknell and pro partner Luba Mushtuk, who were the first couple to be eliminated from the series last Sunday night.

Strictly Come Dancing continues on BBC One next Saturday night at 6.40pm.

description: Strictly Come Dancing 2019 lost its second couple of the series in its annual Movie Week - but who left the dancefloor?
